entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 09 at 1:46PM AKST until December 09 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOW CONTINUES INTO SATURDAY EVENING... The highest accumulations have fallen in the area from the back of the Mendenhall Valley and North of the Ferry Terminal, and at higher elevations. Snow ratios have decreased through this morning and accumulations have slowed down during the day time. Snow will tapper off Saturday evening.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 08 at 7:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVIER SNOW SHOWERS EXPECTED ALONG BRISTOL BAY COAST SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY AFTERNOON... A compact low moving south from the Y-K Delta will bring periods of localized heavy snow showers on Saturday to communities along the Bristol Bay coast (from Togiak to Dillingham, and Egegik to Port Heiden).

The precipitation will start as snow but change to rain tonight as the snow levels rise to near 7000 feet. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 09 at 1:40PM CST until December 10 at 3:00AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Iron County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the northwestern area of the Lac du Flambeau Band.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 09 at 3:08PM MST until December 11 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM SUNDAY TO 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations generally 6 to 12 inches in the Tetons with less in the Gros Ventre Range. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 09 at 3:08PM MST until December 11 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM SUNDAY TO 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches across the northern half of the Salt River and Wyoming ranges. Snow accumulation will decrease farther south, with little to no accumulation expected across the southern end of the ranges.
